instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message: BOARD HAVE USB DATA, THERE ARE VOLTAGE IN all big coils, but fan not turn on, there is image but without backlight for a moment.the display is good and also the fan, I already tried another one in good condition

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message:
The fan not spinning is normal. It doesn't spin the fan until the CPU is 85-90C. 

Are you saying you no backlight then the device shuts off? 

Please clarify.

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message: yes, no backlight then the device shuts off after several seconds

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message:
Machine turns of completely, or just backlight goes off?
Check SMC_LID behavior.
Any history available?

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message: hola me podria colaborar como compruebo smc_lid, se hace con la pantalla conectada? el equipo se le va al backlight el equipo enciende hasta usuario,pero en ningun momento gira ventilador, mido en smc_lid_R en test point, con pantalla conectada y abierto y da 0v, no se si estara bien

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message:
El ventilador no girara (de manera normal) hasta que CPU sobrecaliente.

SMC_LID debe tener nivel alto con pantalla abierta (3.3V) y 0V con pantalla cerrada.

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message: pues SMC_LID siempre se queda en 0v con pantalla abierta y cerrada, como procedo

threads.title: 820-4924-A
threads.message:
Test disconnecting J4802.
If still the same, check R5171.
C5250 is another suspect.

You may need to change the Hall sensor, J5250.
